answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some examples of how other cities handle paying for fees.
In White Plains, NY they have link for paying parking tickets online.
http://www.cityofwhiteplains.com/templates/template_text_image_right_panel.aspx?Id=Metered%20Parking
Similarly, Scottsdale, AZ has an online system for court fees and parking tickets.
https://eservices.scottsdaleaz.gov/eservices/QuickPay/CourtServices/
Milwaukee in addition to its online services offers Violation Bureau Payment Centers around the city for court fees.
http://city.milwaukee.gov/MunicipalCourtFines2216.htm
Alexandria, VA offers a list of places where city fees can be paid.
http://alexandriava.gov/uploadedFiles/finance/info/CashPaymentLocations073010.pdf
http://alexandriava.gov/Payments
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Gregory Stopka
text: A member is interested in building community link centers which would allow citizens to perform tasks such as pay their bills for court or parking tickets around the city instead of in city hall.  Has anyone ever done anything similar?
title: Community Link Centers
